result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A. Poleske

records.addlTxt:
10:59 AM Defendant James A. Poleske in court.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has not retained counsel yet.
Defendant given the Lawyer Referral Brochure.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 09/06/2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

2:17 PM Defendant James A. Poleske in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for James A. Poleske. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
